Class: ActionsSdkApp

ActionsSdkApp(options)

This is the class that handles the conversation API directly from Assistant, providing implementation for all the methods available in the API.

Constructor

new ActionsSdkApp(options)

Constructor for ActionsSdkApp object. To be used in the Actions SDK HTTP endpoint logic.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
options Object JSON configuration.
Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
request Object Express HTTP request object.
response Object Express HTTP response object.
sessionStarted function <optional>
 Function callback when session starts.
Source:
  • actions-sdk-app.js, line 43

Methods

ask(inputPrompt, dialogStateopt) → {Object|null}

Asks to collect user's input; all user's queries need to be sent to the app. The guidelines when prompting the user for a response must be followed at all times.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
inputPrompt Object | SimpleResponse | RichResponse Holding initial and no-input prompts.
dialogState Object <optional>
 JSON object the app uses to hold dialog state that will be circulated back by App.
Source:
  • actions-sdk-app.js, line 409
Returns:
The response that is sent to Assistant to ask user to provide input.
Type
Object | null
Example
const app = new ActionsSdkApp({request: request, response: response});

function mainIntent (app) {
  const inputPrompt = app.buildInputPrompt(true, '<speak>Hi! <break time="1"/> ' +
        'I can read out an ordinal like ' +
        '<say-as interpret-as="ordinal">123</say-as>. Say a number.</speak>',
        ['I didn\'t hear a number', 'If you\'re still there, what\'s the number?', 'What is the number?']);
  app.ask(inputPrompt);
}

function rawInput (app) {
  if (app.getRawInput() === 'bye') {
    app.tell('Goodbye!');
  } else {
    const inputPrompt = app.buildInputPrompt(true, '<speak>You said, <say-as interpret-as="ordinal">' +
      app.getRawInput() + '</say-as></speak>',
        ['I didn\'t hear a number', 'If you\'re still there, what\'s the number?', 'What is the number?']);
    app.ask(inputPrompt);
  }
}

const actionMap = new Map();
actionMap.set(app.StandardIntents.MAIN, mainIntent);
actionMap.set(app.StandardIntents.TEXT, rawInput);

app.handleRequest(actionMap);

askWithCarousel(inputPrompt, carousel, dialogStateopt) → {Object|null}

Asks to collect user's input with a carousel.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
inputPrompt Object | SimpleResponse | RichResponse Holding initial and no-input prompts. Cannot contain basic card.
carousel Carousel Carousel built with buildCarousel.
dialogState Object <optional>
 JSON object the app uses to hold dialog state that will be circulated back by Assistant.
Source:
  • actions-sdk-app.js, line 533
Returns:
The response that is sent to Assistant to ask user to provide input.
Type
Object | null
Example
const app = new ActionsSdkApp({request, response});

function welcomeIntent (app) {
  app.askWithCarousel('Which of these looks good?',
    app.buildCarousel()
     .addItems([
       app.buildOptionItem(SELECTION_KEY_ONE,
         ['synonym of KEY_ONE 1', 'synonym of KEY_ONE 2'])
         .setTitle('Number one'),
       app.buildOptionItem(SELECTION_KEY_TWO,
         ['synonym of KEY_TWO 1', 'synonym of KEY_TWO 2'])
         .setTitle('Number two'),
     ]));
}

function optionIntent (app) {
  if (app.getSelectedOption() === SELECTION_KEY_ONE) {
    app.tell('Number one is a great choice!');
  } else {
    app.tell('Number two is a great choice!');
  }
}

const actionMap = new Map();
actionMap.set(app.StandardIntents.TEXT, welcomeIntent);
actionMap.set(app.StandardIntents.OPTION, optionIntent);
app.handleRequest(actionMap);

askWithList(inputPrompt, list, dialogStateopt) → {Object|null}

Asks to collect user's input with a list.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
inputPrompt Object | SimpleResponse | RichResponse Holding initial and no-input prompts. Cannot contain basic card.
list List List built with buildList.
dialogState Object <optional>
 JSON object the app uses to hold dialog state that will be circulated back by Assistant.
Source:
  • actions-sdk-app.js, line 460
Returns:
The response that is sent to Assistant to ask user to provide input.
Type
Object | null
Example
const app = new ActionsSdkApp({request, response});

function welcomeIntent (app) {
  app.askWithlist('Which of these looks good?',
    app.buildList('List title')
     .addItems([
       app.buildOptionItem(SELECTION_KEY_ONE,
         ['synonym of KEY_ONE 1', 'synonym of KEY_ONE 2'])
         .setTitle('Number one'),
       app.buildOptionItem(SELECTION_KEY_TWO,
         ['synonym of KEY_TWO 1', 'synonym of KEY_TWO 2'])
         .setTitle('Number two'),
     ]));
}

function optionIntent (app) {
  if (app.getSelectedOption() === SELECTION_KEY_ONE) {
    app.tell('Number one is a great choice!');
  } else {
    app.tell('Number two is a great choice!');
  }
}

const actionMap = new Map();
actionMap.set(app.StandardIntents.TEXT, welcomeIntent);
actionMap.set(app.StandardIntents.OPTION, optionIntent);
app.handleRequest(actionMap);

buildInputPrompt(isSsml, initialPrompt, noInputsopt) → {Object}

Builds the InputPrompt object from initial prompt and no-input prompts. The App needs one initial prompt to start the conversation. If there is no user response, the App re-opens the mic and renders the no-input prompts three times (one for each no-input prompt that was configured) to help the user provide the right response. Note: we highly recommend app to provide all the prompts required here in order to ensure a good user experience.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
isSsml boolean Indicates whether the text to speech is SSML or not.
initialPrompt string The initial prompt the App asks the user.
noInputs Array.<string> <optional>
 Array of re-prompts when the user does not respond (max 3).
Source:
  • actions-sdk-app.js, line 657
Returns:
An InputPrompt object.
Type
Object
Example
const inputPrompt = app.buildInputPrompt(false, 'Welcome to action snippets! Say a number.',
    ['Say any number', 'Pick a number', 'What is the number?']);
app.ask(inputPrompt);

getActionVersionLabel() → {string}

Gets the "versionLabel" specified inside the Action Package. Used by app to do version control.
Source:
  • actions-sdk-app.js, line 246
Returns:
The specified version label or null if unspecified.
Type
string
Example
const app = new ActionsSdkApp({request: request, response: response});
const actionVersionLabel = app.getActionVersionLabel();

Version value or null if no value.

string
Example
const app = new ActionsSdkApp({request: request, response: response});

getArgument(argName) → {string}

Get the argument value by name from the current intent. If the argument is not a text argument, the entire argument object is returned. Note: If incoming request is using an API version under 2 (e.g. 'v1'), the argument object will be in Proto2 format (snake_case, etc).
Parameters:
Name Type Description
argName string Name of the argument.
Source:
  • actions-sdk-app.js, line 325
Returns:
Argument value matching argName or null if no matching argument.
Type
string

getConversationId() → {string}

Gets the unique conversation ID. It's a new ID for the initial query, and stays the same until the end of the conversation.
Source:
  • actions-sdk-app.js, line 267
Returns:
Conversation ID or null if no value.
Type
string
Example
const app = new ActionsSdkApp({request: request, response: response});
const conversationId = app.getConversationId();

getDialogState() → {Object}

Gets previous JSON dialog state that the app sent to Assistant. Alternatively, use the app.data field to store JSON values between requests.
Source:
  • actions-sdk-app.js, line 227
Returns:
JSON object provided to the Assistant in the previous user turn or {} if no value.
Type
Object
Example
const app = new ActionsSdkApp({request: request, response: response});
const dialogState = app.getDialogState();

getIntent() → {string}

Get the current intent. Alternatively, using a handler Map with handleRequest, the client library will automatically handle the incoming intents.
Source:
  • actions-sdk-app.js, line 303
Returns:
Intent id or null if no value.
Type
string
Example
const app = new ActionsSdkApp({request: request, response: response});

function responseHandler (app) {
  const intent = app.getIntent();
  switch (intent) {
    case app.StandardIntents.MAIN:
      const inputPrompt = app.buildInputPrompt(false, 'Welcome to action snippets! Say anything.');
      app.ask(inputPrompt);
      break;

    case app.StandardIntents.TEXT:
      app.tell('You said ' + app.getRawInput());
      break;
  }
}

app.handleRequest(responseHandler);

getRawInput() → {string}

Gets the user's raw input query.
Source:
  • actions-sdk-app.js, line 196
Returns:
User's raw query or null if no value.
Type
string
Example
const app = new ActionsSdkApp({request: request, response: response});
app.tell('You said ' + app.getRawInput());

getSelectedOption() → {string}

Returns the option key user chose from options response.
Source:
  • actions-sdk-app.js, line 360
Returns:
Option key of selected item. Null if no option selected or if current intent is not OPTION intent.
Type
string
Example
const app = new App({request: req, response: res});

function pickOption (app) {
  if (app.hasSurfaceCapability(app.SurfaceCapabilities.SCREEN_OUTPUT)) {
    app.askWithCarousel('Which of these looks good?',
      app.buildCarousel().addItems(
        app.buildOptionItem('another_choice', ['Another choice']).
        setTitle('Another choice').setDescription('Choose me!')));
  } else {
    app.ask('What would you like?');
  }
}

function optionPicked (app) {
  app.ask('You picked ' + app.getSelectedOption());
}

const actionMap = new Map();
actionMap.set(app.StandardIntents.TEXT, pickOption);
actionMap.set(app.StandardIntents.OPTION, optionPicked);

app.handleRequest(actionMap);

isRequestFromAssistant(projectId) → {Promise.<LoginTicket>}

Parameters:
Name Type Description
projectId string Google Cloud Project ID for the Assistant app.
Deprecated:
  • Validates whether request is from Assistant through signature verification. Uses Google-Auth-Library to verify authorization token against given Google Cloud Project ID. Auth token is given in request header with key, "Authorization".
Source:
  • actions-sdk-app.js, line 104
Returns:
Promise resolving with google-auth-library LoginTicket if request is from a valid source, otherwise rejects with the error reason for an invalid token.
Type
Promise.<LoginTicket>
Example
const app = new ActionsSdkApp({request, response});
app.isRequestFromAssistant('nodejs-cloud-test-project-1234')
  .then(() => {
    app.ask('Hey there, thanks for stopping by!');
  })
  .catch(err => {
    response.status(400).send();
  });

isRequestFromGoogle(projectId) → {Promise.<LoginTicket>}

Validates whether request is from Google through signature verification. Uses Google-Auth-Library to verify authorization token against given Google Cloud Project ID. Auth token is given in request header with key, "Authorization".
Parameters:
Name Type Description
projectId string Google Cloud Project ID for the Assistant app.
Source:
  • actions-sdk-app.js, line 149
Returns:
Promise resolving with google-auth-library LoginTicket if request is from a valid source, otherwise rejects with the error reason for an invalid token.
Type
Promise.<LoginTicket>
Example
const app = new ActionsSdkApp({request, response});
app.isRequestFromGoogle('nodejs-cloud-test-project-1234')
  .then(() => {
    app.ask('Hey there, thanks for stopping by!');
  })
  .catch(err => {
    response.status(400).send();
  });

tell(textToSpeech) → {Object|null}

Tells Assistant to render the speech response and close the mic.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
textToSpeech string | SimpleResponse | RichResponse Final response. Spoken response can be SSML.
Source:
  • actions-sdk-app.js, line 601
Returns:
The HTTP response that is sent back to Assistant.
Type
Object | null
Example
const app = new ActionsSdkApp({request: request, response: response});

function mainIntent (app) {
  const inputPrompt = app.buildInputPrompt(true, '<speak>Hi! <break time="1"/> ' +
        'I can read out an ordinal like ' +
        '<say-as interpret-as="ordinal">123</say-as>. Say a number.</speak>',
        ['I didn\'t hear a number', 'If you\'re still there, what\'s the number?', 'What is the number?']);
  app.ask(inputPrompt);
}

function rawInput (app) {
  if (app.getRawInput() === 'bye') {
    app.tell('Goodbye!');
  } else {
    const inputPrompt = app.buildInputPrompt(true, '<speak>You said, <say-as interpret-as="ordinal">' +
      app.getRawInput() + '</say-as></speak>',
        ['I didn\'t hear a number', 'If you\'re still there, what\'s the number?', 'What is the number?']);
    app.ask(inputPrompt);
  }
}

const actionMap = new Map();
actionMap.set(app.StandardIntents.MAIN, mainIntent);
actionMap.set(app.StandardIntents.TEXT, rawInput);

app.handleRequest(actionMap);
